While each of the nationalities listed has their own unique cultural and historical context that could influence their approach to walking, I believe that the British have a particularly strong affinity for walking. From the ancient practice of "pilgrims' paths" to the modern-day love of hiking and rambling, walking has long been an integral part of British culture.

They tend to favor more leisurely, meandering walks, rather than the more energetic and fast-paced walks associated with some other cultures.
